column4: You're taking advantage of your hardwares's processing power.
but by how much really?
What application?
Does the application ends with .exe?  Is the application for Windows?
no, it is a linux native app
You might want to try chroot?
the program is not distributed as source, but binary... I installed on a 32 bit vm of ubuntu and tried to copy over but did not work.
You have the .deb ?
http://paste.ubuntu.com/299743/  these are directions I tried to follow.... and no not a .deb it uses autopackage
Is that all of the instruction?
for installing on 64 bit yes...  They assume it is running already on 32 bit...
You might want to try installing 32-bit libraries.
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/32bit_and_64bit#How%20to%20make%2032-bit%20work%20on%20a%2064-bit%20machine
it seems that ubottu is broken, they do exist and are already installed
I don't think ubottu index anything more than main/restricted -- That's my guess.
I do have a vm installed and have this app working there, but it is awkward using a smartboard control from within a window of vm...
There is another website with instructions http://www.crucialthought.com/2009/08/05/how-to-install-smart-notebook-software-on-a-64-bit-ubuntu-machine/  but they didn't work for me...
when I try to install the package using 32bit mode I get this... # Checking for libxkbfile.so ... failed
You could install Ubuntu 32 bit -- Install the server kernel (with PAE support) so you can use all the 6GB ram.
Id rather not do that.  I would rather leave my machine alone than do a complete re-install...
http://www.cyberciti.biz/faq/ubuntu-linux-4gb-ram-limitation-solution/
That is fine. I'm supplying you with choices.
I appreciate the help... reading about chroot option now....
